Robert Schuster

Projects

Guess the Word Game

Description-With JavaScript, users can participate in a letter-guessing game. The game randomly selects a word from a local API and the user has a set number of attempts to correctly guess the word.

Skills:

  • JavaScript
  • API Call
  • Concepts of match(), split(), trip(), join()
  • Single simple regular expresions
  • find text pattern matches

Tools:

  • VS Code
  • Chrome DevTools
  • Git & GitHub version control

Sticky Notes

Description-This project uses HTML, CSS, and JSX to accept user input and save state to local storage. The user can search, add and delete items as they desire.

Skills:

  • JavaScript React, JSX, ES6
  • Greenfield project build
  • UI Component breakdown
  • Managing Data Flow
  • State and Props Values

Tools:

  • VS Code
  • Chrome DevTools
  • Codesandbox

GitHub Repo

Description-Using JavaScript, the API from my GitHub was fetched to display my Public Repos in the DOM. Creating global variables, event listeners, & Click events to use the matches() method, and an async function to pull data for a selected repo, and the ability for a dynamic search of my Repos.

Skills:

  • JavaScript
  • Fetch API JSON data
  • Create Dynamic Search
  • Create Global Variables

Tools:

  • VS Code
  • Chrome DevTools
  • GitHub version control
  • Git

Unplugged Retreat

Description-From a design comp for a 3-page website, I hand-coded a fully responsive 3-page website to the specifications listed. I used Gimp to view the design comp and its elements. I coded the site using Atom and VS Code.

Skills:

  • Responsive Web Design
  • FlexBox Properties
  • Git and GitHub
  • Dissecting a Design Comp

Tools:

  • VS Code
  • Chrome DevTools
  • Git and GitHub version control
  • Gimp

About Me

Hi! I'm Rob

A Front End Web Developer

I have loved programming since writing basic programming in school.
I began building web pages as a way to practice coding. I have been hooked on Front End Web Development ever since.
I tend to lose track of time as a web page takes shape, and my excitement grows with every commit saved to GitHub.
The continuous evolution of web protocols and syntax help keep the practice of Web Development enticing and challenging. Sometimes searching the web to find a solution for coding a particular feature is the most rewarding part.

Fun Things About Me!

If I am not traveling with my travel buddy,
I am jogging, walking, biking, or on a Netflix binge.
